1602 Village Rd. W. ANUPAMA BHAVE Tel: 781.762.3793
Norwood, MA 02062 Mobile: 617.794.5393
E-mail: anupama@mit.edu
Education
1999-2001MIT SLOAN SCHOOL OF MANAGEMENT CAMBRIDGE, MA
Candidate for MBA, June 2001
Concentration in New Product and Venture Development
Marketing Club, Media and Technology Club, e-MIT, MIT $1K business plan competition
1991-1994BANASTHALI UNIVERSITY RAJASTHAN, INDIA
M.S. in Computer Applications; Gold Medal for graduating first in class of 60
1988-1991DELHI UNIVERSITY NEW DELHI, INDIA
B.Sc. (Honors) in Electronics; Graduated 7th in class of 210
Experience
Summer 2000THE McKENNA GROUP, INC. BOSTON, MA
Consultant
Developed, as part of a 4-member team, strategy for Web-enabled drug development process for 
$20+ billion pharmaceutical firm.
Interviewed more than 20 senior executives to assess market needs and explore partnerships.
Defined 4 alternative e-business models based on these interviews as well as additional financial 
analysis, competitive analysis and discussions with client team members.
Presented recommendations to client’s top management. For finally selected e-business model, 
created implementation plan, as well as detailed financials demonstrating $500 million valuation.
1997-1999KINETIC TECHNOLOGIES, INC. VIENNA, VA
Project Leader
Initiated reassessment of company’s existing marketing strategy. Recommended shift in focus from 
acquiring new clients to deepening existing client relationships.
Held comprehensive responsibility for client engagements, including proposal development, contract 
negotiation, project planning, client management and development team leadership
Led 6-member team to develop employee information system for company's largest client. Developed
strong relationships with senior client managers during project. Based on understanding of client’s 
unmet needs, initiated follow-on project worth 5% of firm’s revenues.  
Led 4-member team of software programmers to develop Web-based application for major Federal 
government institution. Completed assignment under budgeted time.
1996-1997DUNN SYSTEMS, INC. CHICAGO, IL
Senior Software Engineer
Held sole responsibility for relationship with major clinical research center client. Led 5-member 
team to develop database application for tracking clinical trial patient information.
Developed Internet-based account management tool for major multinational bank that boosted 
customer satisfaction scores by 15%.
Extensively involved in recruiting, conducting on the average 2 interviews per week.
1994-1996TATA UNISYS LTD. NEW DELHI, INDIA
Software Engineer
Selected over 25 others as application architect for our firm's largest (worth $8 million) project ever, 
for child welfare department of Midwest U.S. state.
Conducted in-depth end-user focus groups to understand client needs and develop design 
specifications.
Led 25-member team in India to implement project according to specifications. Managed beta testing 
of system with multiple end-user segments to refine final production version.
Developed new hire training program and held new hire training sessions three times a year.
Personal
Conducted literacy classes in Rajasthan, India. Taught high school students from shantytown near my 
home in Delhi. Organized yoga classes for community. Enjoy snorkeling, kayaking, traveling.
